name: Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder with Atypical Features
chief_complaint: My child has extreme temper outbursts and is always irritable, but sometimes acts overly silly or giddy for no reason
symptoms: Episodes of inappropriate elation or silliness
treatment: Cognitive behavioral therapy adapted for emotional dysregulation
prognosis: Variable; symptoms may persist into adulthood but can be managed with appropriate interventions. Early treatment improves long-term outcomes.
description: A complex pediatric mood disorder characterized by severe temper dysregulation with intermittent periods of atypical mood elevation that don't meet criteria for bipolar disorder. The condition involves dysregulation in emotional, cognitive, and sensory processing systems.
